summary.p: #90 (#Ph64). a) Tiruvālantuṟai Mahādeva temple; b) on the wall section on the western side of the niche of the dancing Śiva, on the southern façade of the mukha-maṇḍapa; c) personally located and read in situ; d) ARE 1926, no. 244; SII 19, no. 406; SII 32, part 2, no. 199; e) 16th regnal year of Kōpparakesarivarman; f) probably Uttamacōḻa (circa 987 A.D.); g) inscription read with G. Vijayavenugopal.

div.p:
svasti śrī koppara
kecaripanmaṟkku yāṇṭu pa
tin nāṟāvatu Ittiruvāla
mtuṟai mādevaṟkku Utti
ra Ayaṉasaṅkirāti potu
tiruvamutukku Arici kuttal
Aṅkuṟuṇiyum neyyamutu
nāḻiyum tayiramutu kuṟuṇiyu
m kaṟiyamutumgaṇavatiyar
kku paṅkuṉit tiruvoṇatti
ṉāṉṟu Aval Amutu tū
ṇiyum teṅkāy pattum
caṟkkalai pataṉpalamum {space at the end of the line}
Ittaṉaikkum ākadevatāṉam
veṭṭamkkuṭi vaṉṉiccey mayak
ki cantirātitavaṟ ceyvittāṉ
śrī kāryam Ārāñca māṟapirā ṉa
mpiyeṉ Itupanmāheśvara
rakṣai ||

Fortune prosperity! This is the sixteenth year of Kōpparakesarivarman. To Mahādeva of this Tiruvālamtuṟai, on the day of Uttira Saṃkrānti saṅkirāti, for one time potu of holy food offerings tiruvamutukku: five kuṟuṇis aṅkuṟuṇiyum of pounded rice arici kuttal, one nāḻi nāḻiyum of ghee food offerings neyyamutu, one kuṟuṇi kuṟuṇiyum of curd food offerings tayiramutu, vegetable food offerings kaṟiyamutum, one tūṇi measure tūṇiyum of flat rice food offerings aval amutu for Gaṇapati on Tiruvōṇam day tiruvōṇattiṉāṉṟu in the month of Paṅkuṉi, ten coconuts teṅkāy pattum and ten pataṉ? palams measure of sugar caṟkkalai > carkkarai; for all this ittaṉaikkum āka, having prepared for cultivation mayakki the burnt land vaṉṉiccey? in Veṭṭamkkuṭi of the devadāna, I Māṟapiṟaṉ Nampi who examines ārāñca the sacred affairs śrī kāryam have caused to be made ceyvittāṉ the food offerings as long as the sun and the moon endure. This is under the protection of the Panmāheśvaras.
